issue.title: Correctly handle overflow in Native.kevent(...) when EINTR is detected.

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

When kevent(...) returns with EINTR we currently not correctly handle the case of timeoutTs.tv_nsec become negative. This will then lead to EINVAL and so produce an IOException.

Modifications:

Correctly calculate new timeoutTs when EINTR is detected

Result:

Fixes https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/9013.

body: @normanmaurer well get this patch tested tomorrow. I'm curious, did you figure out how JFR triggers this? Or is this a side effect of something else slowing down with the JFR profiling
